elder_company_knowledge.description: Structured company knowledge derived from Elder's live-in care brochure. Split into two sections: what the customer would plausibly know (for the RoleplayAgent) and the full knowledge base the trainee should demonstrate (for the EvaluatorAgent).

customer_awareness.purpose: Inject into the RoleplayAgent's context. This is what someone would pick up from browsing the Elder website for 5-10 minutes before registering interest.
what_they_likely_know: Elder provides live-in care — a carer moves into the home, positioned as an alternative to a care home.
Pricing starts from £1,150 per week, advertised as 35% cheaper than traditional alternatives.
You can view carer profiles and choose your own carer via the MyElder platform.
Only 2% of carer applicants are accepted.
what_they_probably_dont_know: The difference between an introductory agency and a fully managed provider in practice.
How funding works (local authority, NHS Continuing Healthcare, direct payments).
That the family's home isn't counted in financial assessments if the person still lives there.
How respite cover works when the carer needs time off.
The clinical team and family support specialist roles.
Night-time support limits (typically up to twice per night, 15 min each).
That carers work 8-12 hours per day, not literally 24 hours continuously.
CQC regulation status and safeguarding details.
realistic_customer_questions: So is £1,150 the total cost or are there extras?
What happens if we don't get on with the carer?
How quickly can you get someone in?
Do they do nights as well?
Is there any way to get funding help?
What happens when the carer needs a day off?

trainee_knowledge_base.purpose: Inject into the EvaluatorAgent's context. This is what a competent trainee should be able to draw on during the call. The evaluator uses this to assess the Knowledge & Credibility criterion.

core_proposition.what_elder_is: An introductory agency connecting families with self-employed live-in carers. Not a fully managed provider — the care agreement is between the family and the carer directly.
key_differentiators: 35% cheaper on average than managed services because carers are self-employed.
Family chooses their own carer from personalised matches.
ElderMatch technology considers 25+ skill and personality factors.
Only 2% of carer applicants accepted after screening (background check, character assessment, references, documentation).
90% of customers find their ideal carer first time.
MyElder platform for managing care, communicating with carer and Elder team.
Families stay in control — care decisions sit with them, not a care company.
core_proposition.founder_story: Founded by Pete, inspired by his struggle to find the right care for his gran, Frances.

pricing_and_funding.no_hidden_costs: No hidden costs or upfront fees.
pricing_and_funding.carer_food: Budget approximately £40 per week for carer's food, can be included in weekly payments.
funding_options: Local authority care needs assessment — may determine eligibility for financial support.
Direct payments — funds paid to the person's bank account, giving them control.
NHS Continuing Healthcare — full funding for those with intensive health and care needs (e.g. palliative care).
The family home is NOT counted in financial assessments if the person receiving care still lives there.

care_types.standard_live_in: One carer in the home, working 8-12 hours per day, with night-time support up to twice per night (approximately 15 min each).
care_types.24_hour_care: Two carers for those with advanced needs, ensuring active care around the clock.
care_types.palliative_care: For life-limiting conditions. Focused on comfort, dignity, and maximising quality of remaining time at home.
care_types.convalescent_care: Short-term care for post-surgery or hospital recovery.
care_types.emergency_care: Placement often within 24 hours, sometimes same day.
care_types.respite_care: Substitute carer steps in to give the primary carer a break.
care_types.overnight_care: Carer sleeps at the property during the day and provides night-time support.
care_types.dementia_care: Familiar surroundings reduce confusion and distress. Carers provide tailored routines.

carer_details.employment_status: Self-employed — the agreement is between family and carer.
carer_details.screening: Background check, character assessment, professional references, documentation verification.
carer_details.language: All carers must have good written and spoken English. Other language preferences can be accommodated.
carer_details.gender_preference: Families can request a male or female carer.
carer_details.replacement: If the match isn't right, Elder offers a replacement at no extra cost, usually within 24 hours.
carer_details.respite_process: When a carer needs time off, Elder arranges a self-employed respite carer. Families can also make private arrangements or have a family member step in.

carer_needs_in_home: A private bedroom (doesn't need to be en-suite).
Access to bathroom, kitchen, and living areas.
practical_requirements.meals: Carers usually prepare and share meals with the person. Budget ~£40/week for their food.
practical_requirements.working_hours: 8-12 hours per day. Not continuously active for 24 hours.
practical_requirements.night_support_limits: Up to twice per night, ~15 min each. More frequent needs may require waking night care.

process.step_1: Family shares care requirements via the request form (type of care, specialist skills, daily life details). Takes less than 10 minutes.
process.step_2: ElderMatch presents suitable carer profiles, typically within 24 hours. Profiles include experience, background, family feedback, and introductory video. Family can chat online, or arrange phone/video call.
process.step_3: Family accepts preferred carer. Uses MyElder to manage schedule, communicate, and arrange respite if needed.

common_objections_and_responses.too_expensive: At £1,150/week, Elder is 35% cheaper than managed alternatives. Funding options exist. The home isn't counted in financial assessments.
common_objections_and_responses.stranger_in_the_house: Family chooses their carer after viewing profiles and having a call. 90% find the right match first time. Replacement at no cost if not.
common_objections_and_responses.care_home_might_be_better: Live-in care is linked to fewer falls and hospital admissions. Person keeps their GP, routines, social life, and pets. Especially beneficial for dementia.
common_objections_and_responses.what_if_needs_increase: Can move to 24-hour care (two carers). Palliative and specialist care available. Clinical team on hand.
common_objections_and_responses.how_quickly: Often within 24 hours. Same-day in urgent cases.
common_objections_and_responses.is_it_regulated: Elder carers pass suitability screening including background checks, character assessment, and professional references.
